value.title: This month in AWS Machine Learning: September 2020 edition
value.excerpt: Every day there is something new going on in the world of AWS Machine Learning—from launches to new use cases to interactive trainings. We’re packaging some of the not-to-miss information from the ML Blog and beyond for easy perusing each month. Check back at the end of each month for the latest roundup.

value.title: Executives Say Artificial Intelligence Will Boost Productivity; But Their Employees Aren’t So Sure
value.excerpt: For example, while 82 percent of executives see their companies bringing in robot and SI trainers over the next 15 years, compared to only 44 percent of employees. Business leaders see artificial intelligence as taking a prominent role within their organizations.

value.title: At 24.73% CAGR, 3D Sensor Market Size to Surpass USD 7221.75 Million by 2025

value.title: Facial recognition contract extension reopens rifts among Detroit police commissioners
value.excerpt: Facial recognition technology, a contentious topic in Detroit that has drawn national headlines, continues to garner attention and spark debate. The Detroit City Council Tuesday voted 6-3 to extend a $220,000 contract with law enforcement technology ...

value.title: Using Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels and Amazon A2I for detecting pizza slices and augmenting predictions
value.excerpt: Customers need machine learning (ML) models to detect objects that are interesting for their business. In most cases doing so is hard as these models needs thousands of labelled images and deep learning expertise.  Generating this data can take months to gather, and can require large teams of labelers

value.title: Elon Musk put a computer interface in a pig’s brain. Could future AI turn animals against us?
value.excerpt: It’s been a month since Elon Musk and Neuralink trotted out a cyborg pig to show off the company’s progress toward a brain computer interface (BCI). I still see Gertrude in my nightmares. The big idea behind Neuralink is the development of a brain implant that will allow everybody to control computers with their minds.

value.title: Pixel 5 fails to live up to Google’s AI showcase device
value.excerpt: During its Launch Night In event, Google took the wraps off of two new midrange smartphones: the Pixel 5 and Pixel 4a (5G).

value.title: As AI chips improve, is TOPS the best way to measure their power?
value.excerpt: There's more to understanding the performance of AI-capable chips than just a single summary number, even if that's what chipmakers are marketing to users.

value.title: From Microsoft VP to law student: What this exec’s career transition says about AI and the law
value.excerpt: Mike Angiulo worked at Microsoft for 25 years as an engineering manager and vice president for products including Windows PCs, Microsoft Outlook, Xbox, Surface, and cloud and artificial

value.title: VMware Embraces Nvidia GPUs, DPUs To Drive Enterprise AI
value.excerpt: AI is too hard for most enterprises to adopt, just like HPC was and continues to be. The search for “easy AI” – solutions that will reduce the costs and

value.title: These Robots Use AI to Learn How to Clean Your House
value.excerpt: At Toyota, researchers are experimenting with prototypes that swoop from the ceiling to take care of chores with the help of machine learning.

value.title: Say goodbye to hold music
value.excerpt: Sometimes, a phone call is the best way to get something done. We call retailers to locate missing packages, utilities to adjust our internet speeds, airlines to change our travel itineraries...the list goes on. But more often than not, we need to wait on hold during these calls—listening closely to

value.title: Building custom language models to supercharge speech-to-text performance for Amazon Transcribe
value.excerpt: Amazon Transcribe is a fully-managed automatic speech recognition service (ASR) that makes it easy to add speech-to-text capabilities to voice-enabled applications. As our service grows, so does the diversity of our customer base, which now spans domains such as insurance, finance, law, real estate,

value.title: TigerGraph Highlights Next-Generation Graph and Machine Learning Partnerships at Graph + AI World 2020
value.excerpt: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Sept. 30, 2020 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- TigerGraph, the only scalable graph database for the enterprise, today announced that it will showcase multiple key partnerships that are democratizing the use of graph with AI and machine learning at Graph + AI World 2020.

value.title: AstraZeneca uses PyTorch and Azure ML to speed up drug discovery
value.excerpt: The firm has introduced a new production use case for early drug discovery, utilizing the PyTorch framework alongside Microsoft's Azure Machine Learning to support the latest research.

value.title: Superwise.ai named a Cool Vendor by Gartner
value.excerpt: TEL AVIV, Israel, Sept. 30, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Superwise.ai, a pioneer of AI assurance and monitoring solutions, today announced that it has been recognized in the Cool Vendors in Enterprise AI ...

value.title: Detroit Extends Contract of Facial Recognition Program That Doesn’t Work
value.excerpt: The city’s own police chief admits the technology misidentifies 96 percent of time and yet the city voted to extend its use.

value.title: This AI advised me to read The Hunger Games to survive this ‘cruel world’
value.excerpt: If you’re unimpressed by the book recommendations provided by your tasteless friends, a new AI tool called GPT-3 Books could help revive your joy of reading. The system is the brainchild of Anurag Ramdasan and Richard Reis.

value.title: Researchers streamline PTSD diagnosis with machine learning
value.excerpt: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) affects eight million adults in the US, including hundreds of thousands of veterans of the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan. And as the COVID crisis continues to take its toll on everyone's mental health,

value.title: Using machine learning to tackle some of the world’s biggest problems (Infographic)
value.excerpt: A look at some of the promising applications of machine learning to benefit society from understanding climate change to finding homes for the homeless.

value.title: AI chipmaker Hailo accelerates deep learning at the edge
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence chip company Hailo Technologies Ltd. said today it’s launching two new acceleration modules that will boost the processing capabilities of edge devices that run its specialist hardware.

value.title: NeuroMaker STEM Announces Partnership with Vinci Robotics Academy
value.excerpt: NeuroMaker, the STEM education arm of Somerville based company BrainCo announces their partnership with Vinci Robotics Academy, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates STEAM educational programs in the greater Boston area.

value.title: Coralogix raises $25 million to parse software logs with AI
value.excerpt: Coralogix, which leverages AI and machine learning to parse software development logs, raised $25 million in venture capital financing.

value.title: How The Trevor Project continues to support LGBTQ youth
value.excerpt: This September, National Suicide Prevention Awareness Month feels different. value.title: Artificial Intelligence Used To Predict Loneliness In Senior Citizens
value.excerpt: Publishing in the American Journal of Psychiatry, the researchers were able to harness natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning to classify the sentiment and emotions of speech.
